value1: pron, nt acc sg of ta
comment1: Ven Siha suggest that it is form of idaṃ

Siha: This is etad + disa (S. dṛśa), corresponding to S. etādṛśa, tādṛśa. An adjective *ādisa (S. *ādṛśa) is listed neither in PED, CPD nor Cone and is also unknown to MW, Apte and Böthlingk, so it seems this is a ghost word in DPD.

value1: rūpassa nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya paṭipannā, te supaṭipannā. ye supaṭipannā, te imasmiṃ dhammavinaye gādhanti.
na supaṭippassaddho, opakkamikā ce'pi te bhonto samaṇabrāhmaṇā dukkhā tibbā kharā kaṭukā vedanā vedayanti, abhabbāva te ñāṇāya dassanāya anuttarāya sambodhāya.
column18: piṇḍolo vicarasi pattapāṇī'ti. tañ'ca kho etaṃ, bhikkhave, kulaputtā upenti atthavasikā, atthavasaṃ paṭicca.
